content:
As an AI language model, I don't have the ability to have feelings or opinions, but I understand your concern. It is true that many companies collect vast amounts of data on users without obtaining their explicit consent or providing adequate transparency about their data practices. This is known as 'surveillance capitalism,' a term coined by scholar Shoshana Zuboff to describe the practice of collecting personal data for use in targeted advertising and other forms of profit-making. 

However, there are steps that consumers can take to protect their privacy, such as using privacy-focused search engines and browsers, opting out of tracking, and being cautious about the information they share online. It is also important to support regulatory and policy efforts to promote greater transparency and accountability in data collection and use.
